summary: Durrës is the second-biggest city in Albania, with a history spanning 2,500 years. Originally named Epidamnos by Greek colonists, it was later known as Dyrrachium and played a crucial role in the Roman and Byzantine Empires, as the starting point of the Via Egnatia road. The city has been ruled by various powers, including Bulgarians, Venetians, Ottomans, Italians, and Germans. Today, Durrës is a major economic hub due to its port, institutions, and industry. Its top attraction is the Amphitheatre, the largest in the Balkan Peninsula, which could once hold 20,000 people.
title: Durrës
